reasoning: LVH secondary to hypertension is common. Prevalence ~3.5% of general population (35k per 100k) based on echocardiography studies. Incidence (new cases developing LVH) ~8.5 per 100k per year among hypertensive patients. Geographic variation significant based on blood pressure control rates.
source: Gottdiener JS et al. (2000). Left ventricular hypertrophy in the community. JACC. 35(3):569-577
